page.title: 07Stud Farm Quarry-Stanton
page.content: During the visit to{Cliffe Hill {Quarry}Mr.Puttick,Project Engineer, told us that{Tarmac}are investing thirty-three million pounds to establish one of the{largest quarries {in Europe.}This will eventually replace{Cliffe Hill Quarry}although both sites will produce{granite}from the{early 1990's. { Stud Farm Quarry}should yield{five {million tonnes of granite per year}for road building.It is hoped that a large amount of the stone will be moved by rail on a link line to join the main British Rail line near Ellistown. Unlike Cliffe Hill,the new quarry will not dominate the sky line, but will be built with most of the buildings below the sight lines, with screening to hide most of the plant.
